title: Option to omit eTag cache (in favor of solely using last-modified)
description: I like the idea of the http caching features in 1.3 but I don't want it to use ETags.  At least the lastModified headers are based off of a searcher open time but the ETags don't use this and will cause cached results to occur when I do things like restart the server (because I want to pick up changes in my new solrconfig file that affect query responses).

comments.author: Hoss Man
comments.content:
FWIW: this is precisely why the etagSeed option is supported – so Solr Admin's can make the etag change even though the index hasn't changed (ie: because of some other config changes that affect the response).

but i'm open to suggestions for new options ... the key thing being that we want both last-Mod and Etag to be generated by default, even if there is no <httpCaching> directive if hte solrconfig.xml

comments.author: David Smiley
comments.content:
I did notice that I could change the eTag value but why bother force me to remember to change it?

Can you tell me why both eTags & las-mod need to be supported simultaneously?  It seems to me that last-mod alone is just fine.  I like that the last-mod can be based off of the indexreader open time; that seems ideal to me.

comments.author: Erick Erickson
comments.content: SPRING_CLEANING_2013 We can reopen if it's still an issue.
